titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Collection of 19th-century European Sheet Music, circa 1791-1900
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Collection of 19th-century European Sheet Music, circa 1791-1900

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.langmaterial: Texts of songs are in English, French, German, and Italian.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Collection of 125 complete pieces of sheet music from European countries: Austria (5), Belgium (6), England (54), France (9), Germany (31), Italy (14), and the Netherlands (5). Most of these include title page illustrations, about 30 of which are in color. The collection includes an additional 24 partial works, most of which consist only of their title pages. The musical content consists of 44 works for solo piano and approximately 75 works for some combination of voice and piano.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Collection of 19th-century European Sheet Music, circa 1791-1900, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Materials are in the public domain.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection compiled by the Music Library from a combination of purchases and gifts.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The collection was compiled by staff of the University at Buffalo Music Library, drawing on both gifts and purchased acquisitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection of 125 complete pieces of sheet music from European countries: Austria (5), Belgium (6), England (54), France (9), Germany (31), Italy (14), and the Netherlands (5). Most of these include title page illustrations, about 30 of which are in color. The collection includes an additional 24 partial works, most of which consist only of their title pages. The musical content consists of 44 works for solo piano and approximately 75 works for some combination of voice and piano. Overall, the collection provides a representative sample of sheet music publishing practices in European markets during the 19th century as well as lithographic art and some of the extra-musical topics treated as subjects for music during the period. Very few of the works bear copyright or publisher dates. As a result, dates have been supplied from various sources or estimated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:
Arranged alphabetically by surname of composer and then by preferred title of the composition.

unittitle.title: Lieder, op. 39. No. 1-2

scopecontent.p: Title page lists the contents of the Op. 238 collection.

note.p: At head of title: "À Sa Majesté l'Impératrice des Français". American publications used the title Eugenie, grande mazurka guerriere.

scopecontent.p: Title page contains the contents of the Danses Élégantes collection, labelled as "No. 1. La coquette, polka (priska-polka)" [No. 1. The coquette (priska-polka)], "No. 2. La garde mobile, polka (sieges-polka)" [No. 2. The mobile guard, polka (sieges-polka)], and "No. 3. Le train de plaisir, polka de carneval (jahrmarkts-polka)" [No. 3. The train of pleasure, polka (jahrmarkts-polka)].

note.p: "As performed with the greatest success at the Theatres Royal Haymarket and Adelphi" and "dedicated to his friend Benjn. Webster Esqr.".
Color title page illustration: a little girl in a red dress and bonnet hugging a lamb with a red bandana around its neck.

unittitle.title: Ratto di Proserpina. Lieti fiori, ombrose piante ; arranged

Ti veggo t'abbraccio : the favorite duett sung at the King's Theatre by Mrs. Billington and Sigra. Grassini in the opera of Il Ratto di Proserpina,

note.p: First page notes that there are two editions available, "No. 1. baryton ou contralto" and "No. 2. tenor ou soprano". This edition is for "ténor ou soprano".
Composer's last name spelled "Iradier" various places on the music.

scopecontent.p: Additional verses notated without music on the final page.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by surname of composer and then by preferred title of the composition.
